name: Kepler-245
scenarioDescription:
The Kepler-245 Exoplanetary System

Kepler-245 is a star with 0.6950000000000001 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.8 times its radius. It is located 2878.82 light years away from the solar system.

Kepler-245 is known to have 4 exoplanets in orbit around it.

Kepler-245 b

Kepler-245 b was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.07 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 7.49 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-245.

The mass of Kepler-245 b is 9.24 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-245 b is 2.57 that of Earth. At 9.24 Earth masses, Kepler-245 b is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.

Kepler-245 c

Kepler-245 c was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.12 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 17.46 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-245.

The mass of Kepler-245 c is 6.21 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-245 c is 2.18 that of Earth. At 6.21 Earth masses, Kepler-245 c is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.

Kepler-245 d

Kepler-245 d was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.20 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 36.28 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-245.

The mass of Kepler-245 d is 13.72 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-245 d is 3.03 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, Kepler-245 d is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system Kepler-245, which contains 4 planets and was discovered by Kepler.
